revisions.rev:
{{Infobox actor | image = | name = Federico Castelluccio | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1964|4|29}} | birth_place = [[Naples, Italy]] | occupation = Actor | years_active = 1986âpresent }} '''Federico Castelluccio''' (born April 29, 1964) is an [[Italy|Italian]]-[[United States|American]] actor and professional visual artist, who is best known for his role as [[Furio Giunta]] on the [[HBO]] [[television|TV]] series, ''[[The Sopranos]]''.
==Early life== Born in [[Naples]], Italy, his family moved to [[Paterson, New Jersey]] in 1968.<ref>[http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B04EFDD1038F937A35750C0A9679C8B63 "For the Cast, a Touch of Authenticity"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', March 4, 2001. Accessed December 4, 2007. "He was born in Naples and came to Paterson when he was almost 4."</ref> In 1982, Castelluccio was awarded a full scholarship to the [[School of Visual Arts]] in New York City, where he earned a BFA in painting and media arts.<ref>[http://www.corriere.com/viewstory.php?storyid=39495 "Â«I Sopranos? No agli stereotipi ma non facciamone un drammaÂ» - Federico Castelluccio, il Furio Giunta della celebre serie tv, a Toronto per incontrare gli zii"], ''Corriere Canadese'', May 11, 2005. Accessed December 4, 2007. "Nel 1982, Castelluccio vince una borsa di studio alla School of Visual Arts di New York, dove si laurea in pittura."</ref> Just prior to winning the scholarship, Federico received an opportunity to do a painting for veteran actor [[George Burns]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hbo.com/sopranos/cast/actor/federico_castelluccio.shtml |title=The Sopranos: Cast & Crew |publisher=HBO |date= |accessdate=2010-08-16}}</ref>
==Acting== Castelluccio began his career as an actor in 1986. Some of his film credits include ''[[Made (2001 film)|Made]]'' with Jon Favreau, ''Fire'' with Robert Klein and ''[[Diary of a Hitman]]'' with [[Danny Aiello]]. In television, Federico's credits include ''[[NYPD Blue]]'' and his best known role in the HBO hit series, ''[[The Sopranos]]'', as the [[Naples|Neapolitan]] enforcer [[Furio Giunta]].
He also appeared in ''[[A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints]]'' which debuted in 2006 at the [[Sundance Film Festival]] and received two awards, one for best dramatic directing and another for best dramatic ensemble, headed by [[Robert Downey Jr.]], [[Chazz Palminteri]], and [[Rosario Dawson]].
Castelluccioâs recent film projects include the biographical ''[[El Cantante]]'' starring [[Marc Anthony]] and [[Jennifer Lopez]], ''Aftermath'', a crime-thriller starring [[Michael Anthony Hall]], [[Chris Penn]] and directed and written by Thomas Farone, ''The Obscure Brother'', filmed in southern Italy, a short film that Federico executive produced and acted in. Federico starred with [[David Zayas]] and [[Otto Sanchez]] in 2003's ''La AraÃ±a'' directed and written by [[Vincent Zambrano]] and Jose Patino. ''Capers'', a comedic film, was released in 2008 and stars [[Danny Masterson]]. ''[[Lucky Days]]'' is a full-feature film that recently completed filming in New York City. The 2009 film "Forget Me Not", directed by Federico, starring [[Yvonne Maria Schaefer]], had international success. In television, Federico was recently seen as the lead role in ''Dragon Dynasty''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0831285/ |title=Dragon Dynasty (TV 2006) |publisher=IMDB |date= |accessdate=2011-11-02}}</ref>, a made for television film which aired on the [[Sci Fi Channel (United States)|Sci-Fi Channel]]. He also appeared in the episode of ''[[Kenny Vs. Spenny]]'' titled "Who Can Produce The Best Commercial" in a role strongly echoing his work on The Sopranos as Furio.
==Painting== Castelluccio is also an accomplished painter. His fine art paintings are highly technical and influenced by [[Renaissance]] and 17th century Italian and Dutch [[Baroque]] masters. He has exhibited his paintings in galleries in [[New York City|New York]], [[Washington, D.C.]], and [[Santa Fe, New Mexico]], and his works are held in the collection of the [[Yale Fine Art Museum]] and [[Kresge Art Museum]] as well as private collections in the [[United States]], [[South America]] and [[Europe]]. In 2006, Castelluccio and actor [[Paul Sorvino]] were privately commissioned for artwork to be donated as a permanent installation to the [[Boca Raton]] Community Hospital in [[Florida]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} During the fourth season of ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. season 11)|Celebrity Apprentice]]'', Castelluccio was asked by [[Donald Trump]] to judge which celebrity designed the best hat. Castelluccio eventually chose [[La Toya Jackson]]. She was awarded $25, 000 for her charity, the [[AIDS Project Los Angeles]]<ref>http://www.nj.com/entertainment/tv/index.ssf/2011/04/celebrity_apprentice_recap_ric.html</ref>
